intro: Verbascum kalibaricum, commonly known as the Kalibaric mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
